thread.title: Scottish girl attacked by a Staffordshire Bull Terrier
thread.title_full: Scottish girl attacked by a Staffordshire Bull Terrier | Daily Mail Online

author: Paddy Dinham For Mailonline
title: Scottish girl attacked by a Staffordshire Bull Terrier
text:
A toddler has been rushed to hospital with serious facial injuries after being mauled by a Staffordshire bull terrier.
The shocking incident took place in Leven, Scotland, yesterday with the girl suffering wounds to her eyes and mouth.
Officers are now searching the area for the black dog and its owner.
A toddler has been rushed to hospital with serious facial injuries after being mauled by a Staffordshire bull terrier (file image)
A Police Scotland spokesperson told MailOnline: 'Police in Fife are investigating following a report of a dog attack in Kirkside Court, Leven.
'The incident happened around 5pm on Wednesday, February 1, when a black Staffordshire pitbull terrier-type dog attacked a two-year-old girl.
'The child sustained serious facial injuries and was taken to the Victoria Hospital, Kirkcaldy, for treatment, where she is detained.
'Enquiries are still ongoing to find the dog and it's owner. Anyone with information can contact us via 101.'
Police in Fife are hunting to find the dog and its owner following attack, which took place in Kirkside Court, Leven (pictured)
